text: A very nice fruit beer. I wanted to compare this to New GlarusÂ’ rapsberry tart, but this is more tart. Pale red, light pink head, slick mouthfeel. Very nice. Tried at OmahaÂ’s Extreme Beerfest with Jess and the parents in 2017.

2015 bottle, IÂ’ll get another one to cellar. Ruddy red-brown pour with just a ring of off-white left. Aroma is raspberry and raspberries. Mouth-watering. Flavor is just delicious with raspberry dominating a just-sweet-enough tangy and slightly tart. Really smooth, no trace of booze, and not cloying. One of the best fruit beers IÂ’ve tried. Shame on me for passing it by so many times without trying.

Bottle from WegmanÂ’s Mechanicsburg. Pours deep ruby red with a thick white head. Lots of lacing in the glass. Fairly muted raspberry on the nose. Huge raspberry on the tongue with just a hint of tartness. Hides itÂ’s booze really well. Imagine LindemanÂ’s Framboise with 3 times the alcohol and youÂ’re pretty close. I suspect it Ages nicely as well.
2015 bottle pours deep cherry red. Raspberry syrup nose. Very sweet. Low carbonation. Cardboard.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 Bottle, 2015. Nose is pronounced raspberry,strawberry, almond, marzipan. Taste is very sweet marzipan, raspberry, lactose, cheese cake, vanilla, cough medicine,yeast, slight tartness. Mouthfeel is oily. This beer was 2015 consumed in late 2016d, and had no real hop profile, which I suspect my have been deleterious. Labeled as 2015 edition.
In short: artificial like fruit beer.
Pours hazy reddish with nice off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Raspberries, sweet, cloying nose. Medium body, average caronation, oily texture. Taste is berries, sweet, quite artificial flavours.
Pink, pink head, aroma of cherries, berries, flavor of cherries, berries, sweetish, tingling, medium bodied.

Bottle from Vineyard, Belfast. Bright red, small white/pink head. Powerful concentrated raspberry aroma, with syrup, cherry and some wood. Medium body, syrupy/oily texture, lightly carbonated. Taste is fairly sweet, but fairly well balanced by acidic and slightly tart raspberry. Raspberry again very concentrated, almost freeze dried. Long finish. Hides alcohol. Only real criticism is it being a bit one dimensional - you going to need to like concentrated raspberries. First beer my wife has liked ever - extra mark!

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 9/3/2011.

Deep red body. Like a carbonated red wine. Maybe a touch lighter, but close. Pours with a nice pink head. Fascinating for a beer. Leaves nice lacing.

Raspberries, whoah. Before the raspberries kick in, it smells musty, too.

Taste is all raspberries. Like raspberry juice, without all the sugar. ItÂ’s still pretty sweet, but not like an actual raspberry. Not a lot of beer flavors coming through here, but still tasty. Nice tartness in the finish to fight off the sweetness.

No booze, amazingly. Tart finish and a little dry. Still a bit heavy, but itÂ’s 9.2%, so I guess thatÂ’s to be expected. Not easy to drink.

Tough beer to review. Unnecessarily large and difficult to drink, but it has a wonderful fruit flavor.

Bottle, june 25th 2016. Hazy red body with a small pink head. Aroma of raspberries, alcohol, vanilla. Taste of berries, slightly acidic, mild sweetness, and a long berry finish. A little sweet alcohol warm aftertaste.
Somewhat hazy red with a small head. Aroma is full on ripe raspberries. Some slight earthy tones. Sticky and a bit sweet
.75l bottle @Explosive. Pours murky red with low pink head. Aroma is bubble gum, cherry, raspberry, hint of alcohol, malts. Flavor is malts, cherry, raspberry, burned sugar, a bit sourish. Swell!

Backlog 2015 version: Aroma is full-on raspberries with malty undertones and some wet soil. Taste is sweet malty with a raspberry sourness dragging it up from underneath. Some dry seed tartness and very fruity. ThereÂ’s a little more to this one than you first expect. Lovely fruit beer.

Hazy reddish color with pinkish head. Aroma has quite natural raspberry juice notes and some sweet malt. Taste starts slightly tart and sweet, fruity, quite tasty. Overall itÂ’s a quite good fruity beer but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Bomber shared at home. Clear bright reddish pink with light pink head. Lots of sweet raspberries, grassy, sweet grains, light German hops. Really not much else. Very sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied with sticky feel.

Sample @ Charleston Brewvival 2015. Deep reddish pour with a small head. Nice vibrant meaty raspberry on the nose. Quite jammy. Flavor is pretty tart and sharp. More raspberry and dark tart fruits complementing a bit of wood and citrus. Medium body, strong carb. Good.

Pours cloudy reddish with a small white pillow. Aroma is intense sweet raspberries, small yeast. Taste is splendid, light tartness, sweet raspberries with light yeast kicker. Had this with dessert and it really couldnÂ’t have been a better pairing.

Red color. Raspberry aroma, some yeast and fruit. Taste is raspberries, sweeter than expected, with a slight tart finish. Not a whole lot going on but a nice balanced Fruit beer.

Like everyone says, red with pink head that lasts, smells like raspberry sour candy and taste like..........fun. A very cool ale that goes down smooth and has a nice kick.

Bottle (75 cl) from Systembolaget. Shady brownish red, small pinkish head. Rapsberry jelly/candy aroma, some malty notes in the background. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.

Clear dark red pour with light pinkish head. Aroma of raspberries, yeast, tartness and slight earthiness. Taste of tart raspberries, belgian yeast, candy sugar and slight funkiness. Full bodied, lower carbonation, nice balance of the tart and sweet berry flavors. Excellent fruit beer, a real treat!

750ml bottle. Semi-clear redish with one finger cream head. Aroma of raspberries, candi sugar, caramel and light sweet malts. Taste is tart sweet raspberries, candi sugar, light caramel, maltiness, belgo yeast and raspberry jam. Medium mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation and aftertaste of malts, belgo yeast and raspberry jam.
Enjoyable, but too unbalanced and sweet for me. IÂ’d never have guessed the high alcohol content.
Clear reddish of color with a white head. An aroma of raspberries, fruity, red berries, sweets and fresh. A flavor of raspberries, fresh, sweets, fruity and well balanced.

Beautiful crystal clear, deep red with a minimal white head. Huge tart raspberry nose, some light apple, honey, very slight hay. Light tang, quite sweet. Longer finish, coats the mouth. Some light acidity and effervescence. Lightly carbonated. Excellent.

Pours a nice reddish brown. Aroma is full of fruit and malts. Big raspberry flavor with hints of chocolate. To sweet and fruity for me to drink more than one. A real good beer.

Pours hazy red with a pinkish head. Aroma; Rasberry, vanilla, barnyard, funk and oak. Taste; a lot of rasberry,, vanilla, jam, and touch of oak. The rasberry is very dominant in this one but this beer is refreshing
A: Deep red coloured with a pink head N: Raspberry, black currant, raspberry pits T: Raspberry jam, billberry, blackberry O: Very sweet but a very nice berry flavour!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity smell with raspberries. Fruity taste, sweet with lots of raspberries. The raspberries felt a bit artificial.

While the flavor certainly hides the alcohol well, this beer was so sweet when I really didnÂ’t want something sweet, it just wasnÂ’t working for me. A bit tingly. Definitely wouldnÂ’t mind having again when IÂ’m in a different mindset.

Aroma: red berries, raspberries, molasses. Appearance: hazy amber / red, small, light rose, creamy, head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, fruity, raspberries and other red berries again, light citrus fruits, some wood flavours, light tart, berry jam. Overall: nice Fruit Beer, quite sweet. Pint at Kings Arms, Bethnal Green.

Tap at Clubhouse BFD. Pours gorgeous red ruby color. Small head. Aroma is raspberry sweet sugar, Belgian esters. Flavor is, ehh. Rubaeus. Not much different. Sweet. Very sweet. Not bad but couldnÂ’t do a full pint.

20/II/16 - 75cl bottle @ RBBWG V (BenÂ’s place) - BB: n/a, 2015 vintage (2016-222) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the bottle!
Clear bright pink to red beer, small creamy irregular off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots and lots of raspberries, raspberry jam, pretty sweet. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of raspberry jam, citric acidity, bitter touch, some tannins. Aftertaste: bit metallic, bitter, tannins, lots of raspberries. Not too bad!

Tulip from bottle. Deep reddish brown with no head. Aroma is raspberries, Belgian yeast, and sour apples. Taste is raspberry, a bit of funk, and a little sweet fruity flavor. A bit syrupy and well hidden alcohol. Nice beer.
750ml bottle. Hazy headless red body. Tons of candylike raspberry in the aroma, similar to the swedish fifty fifty lollies. Flavor is a bit similar too, with some yeasty notes. Finishes a bit dry.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: pours red with a creamy whitish head. Aroma is a lot of tart raspberry. Taste is raspberry with a sort of Belgiam background. A bit syrupy. A little bit on the sweet side. Some tartness. Strong aftertaste.
Keg at Doghouse. Pours raspberry red with a minute pink head. Aroma is jammy raspberries. Taste is sweet raspberry, raspberry tart, slight oakiness, slight earthiness. Very dessert-ish.
Bottle courtesy of stuu666. Hazy pink/amber. Nose of brambles, blackcurrant, cherries. Taste is a bit sour, very fruity, very tasty.
Bottle thanks to Stuu. Pours clearish pinkish. Nose is pretty much raspberries. Taste is raspberries, light tartness, light funk. Very drinkable but also simple and slightly boozy.

Bottle thanks to Stuu666.
Appearance - bright cherry with nae heid.
Nose - cherry lozenge.
Taste - more of the same.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - solid but one dimensional.
Bottle at Comely Bankers II. Pours hazy red with a thin pink-tinged head. Aromas of raspberry seeds, hibiscus. Taste is sweet. Sweet, fruity finish.
Bottle at appellation. Pours pale ruby, nose is raspberry, funky, taste is dry, fruity, tart, tasty.

Bottle at RBBWG 2016 in Antwerpen, 2015 version. Slightly hazy, red amber with a tan head. Sweetish, slightly fruity aroma of raspberries, sweet cherries, rose hips and some vanilla. Sweetish, slightly sourish and fruity taste of raspberries, strawberries, sweet cherries and almond, followed by a short, slightly bitter, moderately tart finish. Thin to medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel. Very nice!

Thank you for sharing ElManana+1! 660 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG V. 2015 version. Pours a very deep raspberry pink, little pink head. Nose is huge raspberry jam, syrup, similar akin to cheap raspberry cookie filling. Taste is same cheap raspberry cookie filling & raspberry jam, very sweet,Â… Solid body. This is more akin to candy than actual fruit, I like it but it is also a bit too candy & artificial-like to fuly embrace & like but I did enjoy it.
Bottle at RBBWG, thanks for sharing me! Raspberries, very sweet biut very fruity. Nice as a desert beer.

Sampled from bottle @ RBBWG 2016. A bit hazy reddish color, virtually no head. Sweetish, floral aroma. Taste red fruit, raspberry, perfumy again and tart. DonÂ’t like it. Definitely couldnÂ’t finish a bottle on my own.

Tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill, Burlington. Colour is deep clear red with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries,sweetness and some malts. OK if you like raspberries, well I donÂ’t.

22oz bottle from Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean ruby color with minimal tan head. Aroma is sweet and syrupy with huge loads if raspberry marmalade. Hard to pick up anything else. Taste is all of the same, massive amounts o sugars and syrupy raspberries. Light booze. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, easily a drain pour, undrinkably sweet.
Bottle. Pours deep ruby red with a big pinkish head. Aromas of sweet raspberries, gummy bears, sugary, light funk. Taste is the "fuckin same" as my rating say. Lol.
Shared 0,65l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear ruby red with a low pink head. Aroma is malts with slightly sour raspberries. Flavor is malts with slightly sour raspberries. Not too sweet. Great.

as founders blushing monk 2015. clear red to amber, small light red head.
strong aroma of fresh red berries, raspberries, very slightly jam like, but like a very good delicate not-sweet raspberry jam.
Flavor is raspberries, faint malt, faint fruit peel, very fruity, quite tasty. Alc. is almost too much, but the fruit manages to take it without the beer getting cloying, but it is a close call. One of the best non-sour fruit beers i have had ( donÂ’t fancy them much, they get too sweet and cloying)

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares #18 . Pours hazy red with an off white head. Aroma has lots and lots of raspberries, some marzipan, red soda, vanilla, sweet red lemonade and some vimmi bears. The taste is also verry sweet with all the additions from the aroma. Lots of fruit, soda and candy. Also slight ginger as well. You can feel the alcohol is here but it is pretty hidden from the sweetness. Reminds me of something along the lines of the new glarus fruit beers.
Basement Beer Bar 160116. Red colour with a pinkish head. Aroma is raspberry , fruit, almond. Flavour is almond, raspberries, alcohol, yeast. Full body. Very nice beer.
Pours ruby red with pinkish head. Aroma is huge raspberry, candy, sweet malt, whipped cream. Flavor is major sweet fruits and berries, light acidity, sugar. Very very sweet fruity Belgian ale.
Draft. Red beer with a cream head. Raspberry aroma. Sweet raspberry flavor with yeast and malt. Medium bodied. Sweet raspberry and light yeast lingers.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #18. Pours a ruby red with a small, pale pink head. Aroma has a bit of... raspberry. And more raspberry. Winegums, gummybear, slight ginger, super fruity, fruit syrup or squash, very little alcohol, juicy. Taste is sweet, fruity, sour, light boozy, raspberry ice cream.. Candy.. Average high carbonation, surprisingly light body.

Clear red-pink. Small white head. Very distinctive raspberry aroma. Also has some citrus. 

Taste has raspberry. Solid body, sweet, bitter aftertaste. Smooth. Alcohol is hidden very well. More like a juice than a beer. Very tasty.
Sweet and lightly tart raspberry aroma. Cloudy red color with a small white head. Alternating between sweet and tart flavors throughout.

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of raspberries, sweet parfume. Clear red with light pink head, mostly diminishing. Moderate sweetness, light+ bitterness, slight sourness from the berries. Full body, oily texture, avg. carb., dry fruity finish.
Ruddy pour, small white head. Aroma and flavor of very sweet raspberry and cherry. A little over sweet, but good.

[7959-20151127] Bottle. Fruity fragrant berry and sweet fruits aroma. Hazy, dark red amber body with a quick foamy off-white head. Fruity sweetness continues in the flavour with berries and juicy leafiness. Medium body. Interesting but quite sweet. (7/3/6/3/14) 3.3
(w/ jercraigs, mds)

2015-11-27. Hazy dark red-brown body with a small head. 3+ Aroma is quite fruity, sweet raspberry. Touches of green leaf. Flavour is similar, very sweet fruity raspberry. Almost sickly sweet raspberry. Mild green leafy undertones. Average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Tasty in very small quantities but far too sweet. Disappointing. 7/3/7/3-14 Bottle 2015 Vintage from MerchantÂ’s, Detroit.
Drank from a large bottle poured into a pilsner glass. Pours a beautiful red color, has wonderful aromas of raspberries. A good brew does not taste like 9.2%!

Bottle sampled at Studio 1 with Anna, William and Holly. What can I say that hasnÂ’t all ready been said, big raspberry notes, tart finish, hints of yeast and caramel. The good news is that the fruit flavor did not taste synthetic or chemical in any way. Good for the style.

Bottle (2015 version). Pours a deep ruby red with an off-white head. Lots of messy lacing coats the glass half-way through. Aromas of raspberries & raspberry juice -- smells slightly syrupy. Heavy sweetness with a light bitterness creeping up in the finish. Tastes of raspberries. Medium+ bodied and soft. Makes me wish I had some angelÂ’s food cake on hand to pair it with.

Bottle, bought in the States, drunk at home. 

Loads of raspberries and a prominent good head. Raspberries on aroma. Also perfume and spruce. Quite an interesting aroma. Taste is far too sweet for me. ItÂ’s not very acidicy. ItÂ’s very sweet. 750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. 2015 edition. Clear dark reddish with 1-2 fingers of off-white head. Aromas of raspberries, fruit syrup, light booze and yeast. Loads of raspberries in the taste along with spices, light booze, very slight yeasty character. Medium body with a crisp dry finish. Bit of a yeasty/champagne like aftertaste. Very fruit forward.

On tap at HarryÂ’s Hofbrau. The second time I have had this and now it was a full pour. I loved this beer the first time with a sampler size, but it faded a little in a 10 oz. pour. Sour and tart, the fruit displays nicely. Light cherry red and clear with an off white head that is quickly gone.
Bottle from a trade with Darkdusk. Pours a ruby/ pink, white with a pink hue head, no lacing. Nose is sweet, raspberry, fluoride. Tastes sweet, juicy, a touch bitter. Good but maybe a bit too sweet.
Bottle from thornbridge brewery. Bright red pink head. Aroma is raspberries and a bit of cherry. Taste is sweet and tart and juicy. Bit of oil and a nice tingly mouthfeel. Very good.

Bottle shared at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours reddish orange with an attractive beige head and a strong raspberry aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a ton of sourish raspberry. Delicious.
Bottle shared by Eric at capitol beer. Pours red with white head. Nice fruity aroma. Raspberry taste. Great beer

Tastes like juice more than 9% beer. Peach pit aftertaste. Luminous bright/deep red appearance with off-white head.  Maybe I just needed a beer, but really enjoying this.  Alcohol super well-hidden.

Bottle of 2015 Blushing Monk at Kings Table in Dayton, Ohio on September 4, 2015.

Look - Light pink to red to dark raspberry. Bubbly head. Thickest bubbles I have seen. White.

Smell - Raspberry. Grape. Faint tobacco. Raisin.

Bottle from McHughs. Pours dirty red with wispy off white head. Aroma is raspberry, sour, some dough. Sweet raspberry flavour with Saison mouthfeel. Dry tart finish. Lovely.
Draft. Pours a hazy dark red color. Aroma and taste are sweet raspberries and some tartness.

Puce colored pour with off-white frothy head. Big raspberry aromas and flavors, some of the best IÂ’ve ever had in a beer. Sweet and a bit tart, not cloying at all. The ABV helps this fruit beer be bigger bodied and more complex, definitely not one note. Really like it.

As a Rubaeus fanatic this is amazing. Poured into a tulip from bomber. Pours beat red with one finger white/pink head that dissipates quickly. Smell is all raspberry. Flavor follows. I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish with a white head. Taste sweet, sour, raspberries. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

Really fruity. Tons of raspberries up front. A bit tart. Great beer. Hope it becomes an annual.

Ruby red with off-white head. Aroma of sweet raspberries, caramel and some cherries. Very artificial taste, almost like syrupy candy. Quite thin and extremely easy to drink. Way to sweet and simple for my taste, I could just as well drink some raspberry soda instead.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Rasberry in both aroma and taste Maybe to sweet. Fruity finish.
tasting @ fillepolo 150808. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and really sweet with raspberries, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet and fruity with raspberries.

750ml bottle. Hazy dark red with a frothy pinkish head. Flavors are fresh raspberries, raspberry jam/candies, lemon and cranberries with some muffled Belgian qualities. Generous sweetness, light tartness. Medium body, good carbonation, oily texture.

Smells like crushed raspberries. Taste is a nice authentic raspberry juice but not as sweet as the aroma lets on. Still sweet mind you but has a bit of a bittering finish. Boozy finish as well. Deep garnet body is topped by a rosy , two finger raspberry stained head. The head works its way back in short order leaving a ring around the snifter. A moderate amount of lacing is left elegantly clinging to the walls of the glass.

Brewing with fruit can present a challenge to many brewers, even when using fresh product the aroma can appear rather artificial. Founders excels with their use of fruit, pulling out every ounce of fresh berry aroma available. Buried beneath the fruit lies subtle Belgian yeast notes. Slightly peppery, soft phenols meld perfectly into the fruit.

The Flavor displays intensity and restraint. The first sip tastes like a spoonful of homemade raspberry preserves. Strong berry sweetness with an underlying tart finish. The flavor opens up more with warmth, a darker berry sweetness develops and a warming alcohol presence can be felt. While the fruit flavor is dominant the sweetness is held in check, never approaching a cloying level.

Full bodied Belgian ale is very smooth and luscious on the tongue. The carbonation is low allowing the beer to roll elegantly across the tongue. The finish is long and lingering, the succulent raspberry flavor digs deep into the tongue.

2011 bottle thanks to someone at a recent tasting. Pours with a clear violet hue with a small off-white head. Aromas are very sweet, raspberry liquor, jammy, strawberry, vanilla, syrupy. Flavors are plain cloying, raspberry, estery, syrupy. Just way too sweet. Light bubbles, sugary.

I remember the old version being sweet, but not this cloying.

Does Founders make a bad beer? IÂ’m not even a fan of fruit beers and this one blew me away. Wow, is all I can say. Poured a dark maroon color with a reddish, dirty white head. Aroma was dominated by the raspberries. Sweet and tart. Flavor was sweet fruits, raspberries, tart and sugar. Left lacing on the glass as it went. Great beer. Wish this was an everyday beer.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2011 Location: Bottle shared by dbarnold, 9/10/11


Aroma: The nose is rather sweet, lots of raspberry (both sweet and tart) and some yeast

Appearance: This is some purple looking beer!  Reddish-purple color, small head

Flavor: This is a super sweet beer, lots of raspberry fruit flavor, with some tartness as well

Palate: The body is medium-full it has an interesting mouthfeel, and a lingering fruity finish

Overall Impression: 
Thanks for sharing this one, Dave!  This is some interesting, good, but crazy shit.  It drinks like fruit, no joke.  A very interesting fruit beer.  Well-made.  Its sort of in the New Glarus mold.  Good stuff.

Draft at Zwanze Day WLV. Pours a deep ruby red with a pink head. Nose is huge raspberries. Minimal other stuff going on. Perhaps some floral yeast esters, but mostly huge raspberries. A lot like Raspberry Tart, but bigger. On taste, the palate is big and thick. ItÂ’s sweet, but not overly so. Really boozy. Reminds me of raspberry wine, but not as dry. Finish has a decent tannin structure overall. Surprisingly drinkable for as big as it is. Kinda cool.

Purple red pour.  Hazy with a dark red head.  Deep raspberry aroma.  Light tartness.  Very fruity and fresh smelling.  Sweet and tart at the same time.  Very nice intense raspberry flavor.  Sweetness at the start.  Sour and tart at the end.  Alcohol is not noticeable.

Tasted and rated 7/22/11, pours a purplish,magenta, with thick pink head that soon turns thin,aroma of belgian yeast and raspberries. Wow taste is full on raspberry, starts extremely sweet then turns sour, but in a good way.second sip letÂ’s you taste the yeast and raspberry better since you are done witht the initial flavor bomb of the first sip. Love it love it, very different from what I am used to,hope to see it again next year
On Tap. fruity and tasty, but with a hint of funk, but only a hint, not as good as alot of framboises, but not bad.

On tap at Zwanze day 2011 Chicago. Pours a clear deep reddish purple with a deep pink head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is full of sweet and tart raspberries, and nothing else. Flavor is full of sweet raspberries with a bit of tartness, but overwhelmingly sweet.

Well I finally cracked into it - gotta give props to raveskdr for telling me about this one before it was gone. Poured a blood red color, with a dark pink foamy head. Aroma was raspberries, raspberries, raspberries. The fruit level in this one was almost at lambic levels. The alcohol is pretty well masked, but itÂ’s probably just because the raspberry sweetness is so overpowering. Touch of Belgian yeast. Very tart, very unique, very very good.

750ml Bottle:  Sweet, raspberry, dark berry, slight cherry aroma.  Poured magenta/deep red/ruby in color with a medium/sized, purple/magenta/pink head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy. Very sparkling.  Good lacing.  Flavor is heavily sweet and a tad.  Tastes of raspberries.  Delicious.  Light to medium body.  Lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Sweet raspberry finish.  9.2%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Draft at Blind Tiger with Brendan, Andrew, Streets and Baron. Pours a deep, deep red, nearly black with no head. Aroma is sweet raspberry candy. Mouthfeel is tart with notes of sweet raspberries and strawberry jam. Stellar fruit beer.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2011 On tap at Blind Tiger with Andy, James, Streets, Baron. Deep red pour with bright red hue. Bright red head when stirred up. Considerable  carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel and light to medium body. Very sweet, mildly tart and fruity all-around. Raspberry and strawberry. So good.

Thanks to PaulUnwin for sharing this one.  Cheers, Paul!  Pours a light brown with red highlights and an off-white head.  Nose is raspberry puree, seeds, malt, candy sugar, caramel, slight vanilla, and a table sugar.  Flavor is sweet as hell with raspberries all up in there.  Whatever they did to the raspberries yielded the fruit, the pulp, the skin, and the fuzz along with every noticeable quality of a raspberry.  The quad is a bit lost, but it plays a nice supporting actor role like Gary Sinise in Forest Gump.  The quad qualities are really nice as the candy sugar melds well with the candy sugar in the quad.  Medium to full in body, and very loveable.  This one is a sipper that will age nicely.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  Such a cool looking pinkish red head and it is big.  Dark cherry color to the beer.  This is like a high quality wine cooler.  It is really sweet.  It is also tasty.  It is very good but is so sweet!  We had it side by side with a New Glarus Belgian Red and the NG beer was much sweeter.
750 ml bottle. Fine raspberry aroma and color. Medium body and head. Strength is completely natural fruit taste which lingers. Belgium yeast makes only a modest contribution.
On tap atCaponeÂ’s. Poured a deep pinkish, red color with an averaged sized pink head. Aromas tastes of raspberries. Sweet and tart. Fresh berries.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Snifter. 2011 release - canÂ’t find a date but assume it was bottled in June.

Appearance: Gorgeous ruby red with thick pure pink head, leaving nice pink lacing. When there is only a little liquid left in the glass, the beer looks more pink than red.

Aroma: Raspberry (of course), pepper and very light clove & banana from the yeast. Manages to smell sweet, dry and tart at the same time.

Taste: Wow - strong sweet and tart raspberry juice. Slightly earthy, but otherwise not getting much Belgian yeast. Ends with a touch of pepper to go along with the lingering raspberry tartness.

Palate: Very thick, chewy and warming. DoesnÂ’t really feel like a beer (more like carbonated fruit juice mixed with Port), but it suits it just fine.

Overall: Very impressive, and I like it quite a bit more than Cerise (never tried RÃ¼bÃ¦us). However, despite the gorgeous look, tantalizing aroma and strong taste, it is ultimately too far outside the realm of beer (even Sour Ales seem more like "beer" to me) to want to seek this out again.
Bottle. Pours purple with pink head. Nose and taste is straight up fresh raspberry puree with pits and seeds. Very delicious! Some hints of chocolate in the deep background. Medium body.
on draft at the thirsty monk. deep dark red ruby color pour. no head or lacing the absolute in perfection of a raspberry beer. so soft and smooth that this beer is absolutely incredible to sip on.

Bottle.... Deep ruby pour , big blush colored head that diminishes quickly , some sticky lacing .  Aroma of yeast and raspberry pie .  Taste is pure raspberry preserves , like Smuckers liquified . Sweet but not too sweet or cloying . surprisingly light and dry . Medium bodied and carbonation . Finish is tart and dry . A real pleasure to drink .

Poured from bottle, pours a deep red with a thin pink head, the aroma is full of fresh raspberries mixed in with a tad of funk, the flavor has a nice sour funky front end, you can almost taste the seeds that come with biting into a fresh raspberries, the finish is fairly sweet but it really works, not on par with Tart but still darn good.

Thanks to lithy, I had an opportunity to try this at the 2nd Pgh Tasting on the 2nd.   Very nice looking presentation in the glass; looks like grape juice with a head.  Aroma is simply lovely; big fresh fruit raspberry thing in your nose, makes you forget all about your problems in life. My mouth is watering before I drink it. Taste? What taste? I think I died and went to nirvana or heaven er sumthin.  I am dizzy with greatfulness as I sip this pleasure. This is styled as a fruit beer but it is not your typical fruit beer by any standard, its more in line with the best fruity lambics. This whole session with this gift is just so niiiiiiicccccceeee!      Yummy fun for the taste buds. You would never know this is more than 9%, it canÂ’t be. There is just a touch of alky on the palate, seems more like 3%.  This beer must be scary when doing a bottle, if it really is 9.2%.  Raspberry raspberry raspberry, lovely raspberry. This is what all fruit beers should strive to be, not a hint of artificial flavor what so ever. Lithy, THIS BEER ROCKS!  Great, galore of beer tasting never forgetfulness. Big thanks to Justin for this brew!  Truely the highlight of the tasting event!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
A: The pour is a deep dark red color with a tall pink head that dies down after a minute or so.

S: An intense raspberry aroma, sort of as expected. There is a little bit of grass to it and some other fruit notes, perhaps some cherry skins. ItÂ’s got an almost fruit wine sort of smell to it.

T: Very sweet with lots of raspberry flavor. ThereÂ’s a bit of banana ester in the background and perhaps a hint of chocolate. Lots of berry sweetness, almost like raspberry jam. A tiny bit of grass on the mid-palate.

M: Medium bodied with medium carbonation.

O: IÂ’m not always the biggest fan of beers like this, but it isnÂ’t quite as cloying as some others.

Courtesy of Dak pouring up cherry cough syrup with very thin white head containing some pinkish hues. The aroma is earthy sweet cherry and really little else that I could come up with. The taste is an explosion of flavors with raspberry tartness and sweet candy cherry sweetness. To midway it gets more and more red wine like in its dryness and seems to feebly mix with sweeter malt notes. Pretty cool stuff though.
Dark dark blood red wine, light pinkish cover.  Aroma is seedy raspberry puree, light alcohol or something putting me off a bit.  Taste is really nice, seedy raspberry syrup, sweet, sticky.

Tap at Sugar Maple.  The beer pours to a very dark but translucent reddish-pink  body with with a dark pink head.  The aroma is of fresh raspberries, sweet straw-like grains, and raspberry leaves.  The flavor is intensely sweet raspberries, pectin-like jam, and nectarines or peaches.  The palate is super sweet but very thick and textured.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  This was a treat, and much better than the last batch I had.

Botle via Notch... This beer looks awesome, pink with a dark purple tint. Good head that fades quickly. Good aroma... sweet raspberries. Taste reminds me of a slurpee... Sweet but not sugary, raspberries. Nothing but raspbeeries going on with this beer but some how remains balanced and interesting..... Really easy to drink. Light body. Overall: Not sure why this has its own rating compared to the previous batch that I had.... taste the same.  Great beer.

Thanks to Jale for this bottle... wow, this is a stunning looking beer, dark blood red with a big light purple head, great thick lacing, perfect looking... the nose is really nice, fresh pureed raspberries that are sweet with a bit of tartness, real pure...  the taste is merely meg, way too juicy, generic wine, just weird and boring... really conflicted, weakest of recommendations

Bottle with Pat. Pours a dark velvet with ruby, bubbly head. So weird to see a dark purple colored head.Settles down to leave a slick surface with some spotty suds. Aroma is pure raspberry jam, with hints of hibiscus and some soft notes of cotton candy, strawberry and bubble gum. Flavor is very sour, pungently tart raspberry juice with some subtle biscuity, malty hints; the palate is very sticky and syrupy. Other notes of vanilla and artificial raspberry. Finish is ever so slightly sour before fading to a calm, even raspberry sweetness. Too much sugar for me. Good beer, and an efficient concealer of its alcohol content, but not meant to be split between two people. This beer is worth trying, but I canÂ’t understand all the hype and prices some bottles are going for. I guess this is related to Founders top quality and maybe limited distribution but I have to check on that. Cheers

Rating 100. 750ml. Pours a syrupy dark ruby red with pink head. Aroma of fresh sweet raspberries. Taste is a sweet raspberrys that slowly works into a nice tartness. Mouthfeel is very nice with perfect carbonation. Very well balanced fruit beer. Finish is a nice dry (like wine) raspberry tartness that wraps up very clean. Alcohol is very well hidden. What a treat. Not sure I would spend another $15, but glad I tried it.

750 ml bottle, that poured a nice dark red color with a pink head, looked amazing.  Had a raspberry aroma and the taste was the same.  Had a nnice tart/sweetness balance throughout.  Really glad I got to drink this.

Bottle generously shared by Ross - thanks!  Dark cherry red pour with slight foam bubbles.  Aroma is over-the-top sweet, sugary raspberry, and the taste follows.  Bit of a tart prick toward the finish.  Nice sweet beer but too sugary for my personal preferences as compared to the Â’07.
Bottle. Pours a red color with pink head. Smells of cherries, berries, and soap. Very sweet at first like juice and then finishes with a tart taste. ABV well hidden. Very good example of the style

750 mL bottle from Whole Foods Market Short Pump/Richmond. Pours a clear dark red color with a frothy pink head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of intense raspberries, some blueberries and a bit of a cheesy note. The taste is intense raspberries, both sweet and tart, along with banana, blueberries and strawberries. A bit of a nutty, herbal note also. Medium-full bodied. A worthy 4300th rating!

Had this during the 2011 Shenandoah Throwdown.  Bottle I brought.  Pours a deep cranberry red, lightly hazed, with a thin pink head.  Big juicy fruit and raspberry, soft fruit.  Raspberries and chewy fruit.  Tangy and tart, big fruit.  Leathery fruit, tangy and warm.  Sweet and smooth.

Tap, Big Hunt. Ruby reddish, deep pink with foamy and soft slightly pink head.  Very nice looking brew.  Sweet sugary raspberry fruitiness dominates the aroma, with some sherbert notes as well.  Taste follows suit, but too much candy-like sweetness on top of the fruitiness and only has a faintlly tart finish.  Medium body with sublty fizzy carbonation, and a bit sticky.  Just too sweet and not my thing, but the booze was completely hidden.

Shenandoah Throwdown. 75cl bottle, thanks j12601.  Murky violet body, small white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, raspberry, light tart, orange.  Taste is moderately sweet, raspberry, tart, some alcohol.  Medium body, some stickiness, light acidity.

Wow! A delicious fruit beer. Aroma was pretty good. All sweet raspberries and hints of yeast. Pour was stunningly beautiful. Dark, rich red with a thin pink film for a head. Taste was very crisp, delicious and refreshing. Strong sweet raspberries in the front, middle and aftertaste. The sweetness turns to sour after the swallow. Could pick up some Belgian yeast coming up the sinuses as well. Strong biting carbonation. This beer tastes like a 5% foo foo fruit beer so you never realize what you are drinking is 9.2%. Excellent!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 750mL thanks to j12601. Pours a hazy, dark purple color with a healthier pink head emerging. Nose is fresh raspberry dessert, more like sweet raspberry preserves rather than tart, seedy raspberries. Taste is is good- sweet but not sugary, rich raspberry dessert, almost like quenching fruit punch. Loads of raspberry jam piling on. I like it, but it doesnÂ’t have the subtlety of New Glarus Raspberry Tart, which not only has intense raspberry component but also something aloof like dense wheat beer and rustic grain. Overall, NG Raspberry Tart is a few good beer with loads of raspberries all over the place. This feels completely like raspberry preserve fruit punch, which is delicious but so far flung from "beer" categorization. 9.2% is completely unnoticeable, which is pretty scary.

Very impressed with this beer.  Pours dark red almost purple with a slight red head.  Raspberries all over...nose, palate finish.  Really strong in the raspberries, and I enjoyed that.  Finish is slightly tart and strong.  I enjoyed this as much or more than any other fruit beer, because while it had a strong  fruit flavor.  Very good if you can find it.

Wow...what a surprise. Thanks to my friend that brought it over, with 7 Ribeye Steaks. This beer poured into my Great Lakes pilsener glass Blood Red with a pink carbonated head. Some light lacing down to the bottom. Aromas of huge fresh raspberries, and a bit of Belgian yeast. Very strong sweetness on the nose. Taste is Thick and syrupy but not as sweet as you would expect, a nice balanced tartness. Some notes of tart raspberries linger on the finish for a bit with some spiciness from the yeast. No alcohol noticed in the taste or finish. Hidden very well....12.3%, who would have thunk it. What a treat.

Bottle 75 cl, courtesy of Mikkeller. Pours dark purple, small pink head. Aroma has fresh raspberries, raspberry sweet, just pure raspberries and forrest berries, really nice. Taste has raspberries, rather sweet, but with a slight tartness in the finish, which gives a really nice balance to the sweetness.The raspberries are really authentic, really well done.

Great fruit beer, Big raspberries on nose and palate, a little tartness and no alcohol presence even though its over 9%. Tart raspberries in a long complex finish. Another flawless victory by the magicians at founders.

Awesome fruit beer that was almost as good as NG Raspberry Tart even though the ABV was over twice as high.  Aroma is rich raspberry and spices.  Taste is tart raspberries with nice sweetness and a little hop bite at the end.  Really tasty stuff
Pours a blood red color with a thin head. Has a nice raspberry smell to it. Big raspberry taste. Very smooth and ABV is well hidden.

Thanks to Lee for bringing this, very excited to try this! .. . Pours a deep plum, light foam .. . raspberries mostly in the nose, as with the flavour .. . very tasty stuff, but not as sweet as you would think, which retains its quality .. . I really enjoyed this! .. . . IÂ’ve had it with this school, Skinner. Low test scores, class after class of ugly, ugly children

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Appearance is dark purple with a moderate sized, purple head. Aroma is of tart red raspberries with a slightly funky note. Taste is sour red raspberries through and through. The alcohol really plays almost no part in this beer. I really had to dig deep to find it but it lies in the very back of the throat in the finish. Velvety smooth mouthfeel. Just another kick ass beer from founders.

Thanks to rogueone for sharing a bottle. The beer pours a lustrous pinkish-purplish-red color with a medium pink-white head that diminishes slowly. Sticky rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of fresh raspberries and a touch of yeast. Medium body with a tart raspberry character and notes of malt and yeast. The finish is fruity with a lingering raspberry and Belgian spice aftertaste. Not quite on par with New Glarus, but glad this one is back again.

Bottle shared at the District.  Garnet pour with a pink head.  Raspberry nose.  Tart and refreshing with all kinds of ruckus raspberry, acidic stone fruits, and cherry flavors.  Similar to NG Raspberry Tart but a little more tart and effervescent.

Founders blushing monk. 750ml purchased from lush roscoe... Pours a deeper black cherry hue, predominantly opaque and then topped with a lighter pink head that quickly dissipates to a wispy film leaving a bit of residue on tap... Aroma is syrupy, thick and sweet with a strong deep raspberry presence. Some yeasty notes mingle alongside the aforementioned. Hints of cloyingness which doesnÂ’t seem all that refreshing... Flavors are an improvement at least for me. Assertive raspberry notes which commences first with a sweeter profile upfront and through the middle. Not as much of a yeast presence in the flavor.  
Finishes with a slight tartness which makes it pretty enjoyable, at least compared to the nose. Medium to full bodied with semi-lively carbonation.
7/4/8/4/15
750 ml. bottle.  Ruby red with a red head.  Rasberries in your face.  This beer doesnÂ’t taste strong.  Refreshing.

Bottle at MaltzillaÂ’s tasting. Pours dark reddish pink color with pink head. Aromas of fresh raspberries. Sweet and tart raspberry flavor. Medium body with average carbonation. Right up there with NG Raspberry tart. Very nice dessert beer.

Bottle poured into snifter. Ruby red color with a thin bubbly head. Aroma is just fruit, that is all. Raspberries, vanilla and cream. Extremely sweet but delicious. Definitely an after dinner dessert beer.
Deep ruby pour. Tons of ripe raspberries, chewable vitamin C. Flavor us sweet and tart, raspberries. Nice balance of sweet and tart.

A: pours dark clear red, with a bout a finger of dark pink head. 
S: raspberries...sugary sweet raspberries. 
T: again, sweet raspberries. There is a small bit of raspberry tartness on the back-end. Sticky sweetness. 
M: sticky, syrupy, low carbonation
O: I think this would be more interesting if it was fermented with brett and other  wild yeasts.

2011 vintage. Finally, I sit here opening a bottle of my all-time biggest want. This bottle is in celebration of the NFL Lockout being lifted, and the Panthers re-signing Charles Johnson! For what itÂ’s worth, I have had this before, on tap.

This beer pours a full bodied dark red, reminiscent of a framboise, with a two finger, ValentineÂ’s Day pink head. It smells of Belgian yeast and sweet and tart raspberry puree. The raspberry is overpowering and delicious. It tastes of sweet raspberries, first and foremost, with a moderate tartness and a Belgian yeast finish. It offers complexity in terms of raspberry, offering every aspect of the fruit, but the beer itself is dominated by the raspberry. It is delicious and is like an imperial framboise. It drinks full in body and really is a big beer. I couldnÂ’t be more pleased with it. ItÂ’s an exceptional beer and one of my all-time favorites. I canÂ’t wait to open an Â’07 in the following months!

750ml bottle from grape & gourmet split with LJ. pours a deep, dark red that sits almost burgandy in the glass with a thick, effervescent pink head with great retention that leaves sticky rings of lace. aroma is absolutely outstanding with huge notes of fresh picked raspberries, raspberry jam, and raspberry puree backed by subtle but elegant notes of rose petals, vanilla, and hibiscus with a touch of lemon zest and dusty funk. flavor is wonderful as well with the true essence of a belgian ale up front with funky yeast, wheat grass, lemon zest, and belgian spices backed by slightly sweet/slightly tart raspberries, red grapes, and light notes of cherry candy and finishing dry and sweet with just a tickle of tart berries. palate is medium bodied and perfectly carbonated and the balance of sweet and tart keeps it from being too syrupy. overall, and outstanding fruit beer thatÂ’s right up there with NG raspberry tart as the best iÂ’ve had.

Bottle.  Dark red pour, beautiful bright red carbonation and a tart fresh raspberry aroma.  Flavor is tart vibrant raspberries and enough of a malt backbone to back it up to prevent it from being an overly sweet sugar-bomb.  Very good!

Draft at Blind Pig in Champaign, IL. Pours a deep purplish brown with a purple hued head. Aroma of rasperries and malt. Full bodied with a thick mouthfeel. Flavor is like the aroma, full of raspberries and rich malts, but with loads of sweetness (Think LindemanÂ’s fruit "lambics"). Alcohol dangerously well hidden. This is not a bad dessert beer, itÂ’s sweet and thatÂ’s fine. But why in the hell is this in a 750? Anything beyond 8 ounces is a bit much to handle in one sitting. Put this in 4 paks like Devil Dancer.
Bottle pours dark red with frothy, pink head.  Taste and aroma of raspberries.  Not overly sweet.  Slight tartness.  Hides the % alcohol well.  One dimensional but delicious.

What a raspberry bomb, if you are looking for fruit and sweetness this is your cup of tea...er...fruit.  It even looks pink. This beer covers alot of the other natural flavors normally associated with beers and keeps pounding the fruit into your mind. Where is the alcohol, i dont believe this is 9%. Liar.

OMG!  Pours red with a pinkish red head.  Smells like raspberry jam.  Strong sweet raspberry flavor.  Almost like candied raspberries.  9.2 abv?  No trace of it at all.  Even the non beer loving wife loved it.  Flavor lingers on the palate forever.  Overall an AWESOME beer!

2011 Vintage. Picked this bottle up at the Whole Foods on P St NW in DC. Served in a Founders tulip. Reviewed from my tasting sheet.

Pours a bright light purple color that is quite similar to a light grape juice. Really nice head with a slight pinkish hue. Spotty lacing on the way down. The nose brings loads of raspberry to the level of BarqÂ’s Raspberry Cream Soda. Not much depth, but I donÂ’t really care, especially once it gets into the flavor. There is some slight yeastiness on the backend of the flavor, but for the most part this is just a raspberry assault that is absolutely beautiful. Some light earthiness, especially in the feel. Lightly tart and fairly sweet, though not too much. Really outstanding beer.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle shared by Pete @ BCTC.  Great ruby body & red head on this one.  Nose is super raspberry character, as is the flavor.  The fruit totally dominates here.  IÂ’d love to have this side by side with New Glarus Raspberry Tart.

poor is a deep dark brown red like a cab. smell is both sweet like over ripened raspberries and not quiet ripe cherries. taste is sweet first when cold with a little tart punch. as it warms it gets more cheek burning tart. love it.

Poured from a bottle and the color was a dark blood red with a red tinged white head. Very deep full fruit aromas. Medium body and rich and jammy almost in your mouth. Fresh raspberry flavors which were nice. Very slight tartness but not much. The strength of the fruit was a litle much after a few samples from the glass. A bit more tartness would have done this beer well in my book. Great to try it for sure.
bottle. beautiful deep raspberry color. Big fruit forward raspberry aroma. sweet berry flavor, somewhat boozy. It all blends into one great flavorful fruit beer

Deep reddish raspberry color quick receding bubbly pink head ...... abv hidden well in the aroma and taste ... fresh raspberry aroma and taste almost wine like low carbonation ... bitter and sour tart raspberry with just the right amount of flavor and sweetness more of a natural sweetness .... an awesome brew with a dry raspberry finish better than new glarus by a tad

Serving: Bottle at Fireworks.  It pours a pretty deep red with a small, pink head.  The nose is very raspberry with a touch of cellar character.  The flavor is tangy but leans towards the sweet side with a good dose of fresh raspberries.  It comes across as a little heavy on the tongue and could use a bit more carbonation.  Somewhere between a LindemanÂ’s and a true lambic, probably leaning more towards the Lindemans.  I appreciate the effort, but itÂ’s not one I would get again.  Too sweet for my taste.
Pours ruby red with a pink head.  Aroma is raspberries with a touch of funk. Flavor is raspberries, a bit of funk, cherries, plus some hints of alcohol. Full bodied with medium carbonation.

Tart and sweet like raspberry sorbet with a belgian yeast giving it a unique herbal funk. I used to need a trip to Wisconsin for this! Love the acidic streaks amongst the dry palatte and sweet profile. Some leathery sourness in there too.

750ml bottle. Thick brew.  Pours a bright, ruby-red color with a pink head that fades pretty quickly. Aroma is nothing by raspberry. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, raspberry, some spicy Belgian yeast, with a sweet, raspberry finish. Not as tart as New GlarusÂ’s Raspberry, but just as good.

Bottle: pours dark red with a fizzy pink head that disappeared quickly, smells just like raspberry jam, taste is raspberry obviously, rich, smooth but not overwhelmingly sweet, a touch syrupy. Excellent!

7/29/11. 750mL bottle courtesy darn1207. Nice ruby red pour with just a touch of pink head, but really not much. Huge fresh raspberry aroma with black cherry and more. Big sweet raspberry flavor with plenty of sour kick. Reminds of a raspberry/cherry candy or something. Very good, but not as amazing as I was expecting.
really good beer delicious flavor and full bodies smell. Bought it at a local shop founders is a great brewing company.

Bottle. 24.5 oz. Split with Vinnie. Pours a deep maroon with a ruby, bubbly head. Settles down to leave a slick surface with some spotty suds. Aroma is pure raspberry jam, with hints of hibiscus and some soft notes of cotton candy and bubble gum. Flavor is very fresh, pungently tart raspberry juice with some subtle biscuity, malty hints; the palate is very sticky and syrupy. Finish is ever so slightly sour before fading to a calm, even raspberry sweetness. Really good beer, and an efficient concealer of its alcohol content, but not meant to be split between two people. Vinnie and I both agreed that this would be much better shared amongst three for four friends.

Draft at The Royale served in a tulip. The rating is compiled from the first glass- with dinner- and second glass of the three I had in the course of a Tuesday evening. This rating is also under the correct entry, which canÂ’t be said for a handful of recent ones on the old version. Anyway, this one pours a gorgeous deep, mostly opaque ruby color with a finger-thick pinkish-purple head. The aroma starts out pretty one-dimensional with fresh, rich raspberries, but opens up as it warms to reveal some Belgian yeast characteristics, dusty funk, apple and grape skins, and earthy notes. Flavor of nice raspberries, cherry juice, floral notes, and some more earthy, funky Belgian yeast characteristics. Medium-bodied, with a fresh, fruity, and eventually tart mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Top-notch fruit beer.

Sampled at Jackie OÂ’s during OBW on 7/13/11. Darkest red pour with a thin beige head. Malty and crisp nose with a ton of raspberry character. Raspberry hits the palate first (a bit sweet, a bit tart and a bit feety) before caramel malt and the finish is huge raspberry. Pretty solid fruit beer.
Draught at Beer Trappe. Raspberry. Lots of it. Not too syrupy. Some tartness mixed with sweet. Nice overall and enjoyable.

750 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market in Elizabeth City, NC.  Deep red pour reminiscent of cough syrup but with a short pink fizzy head.  Aroma of sweet berries and little else.  The flavor is much more tart than the aroma would lead you to believe yet there is still a generous amount of sweetness on the finish.  Unfortunately the sweetness comes off as a bit artificial tasting but that is a minor quibble.  The alcohol does not seem like it is 9.2% but it does seem more potent than similar beers.  Excellent overall and the best fruit beer outside of Wisconsin.

Draft sample at MBGSF 11. Poured raspberry color with moderate fizzy raspberry color head that diminished slowly with good lacing. Good tart raspberry and citrus aroma. Medium body with smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate sweet flavor with a moderate tart fruit and small alcohol bite finish of medium duration.

The aroma is mainly raspberries, some malts, other cereal grains, slight belgian yeast.  The color is raspberry, pink/purple head.  The flavor is raspberries, some spicyness, alcohol, caramel malt.  the finish is sweet, raspberry, pepper, alcohol, and after all that, a resiny hop bittering.  Interesting beer.  The raspberries really overwheelm here, much like the New Galrus raspberry.  Expensive, $17 for a bottle. But itÂ’s an enjoyable beer, interesting to try.

Poured a dark burgundy with very pink foam. The aroma is a full on blast of raspberry. Not much complexity but it does the raspberry really well. The taste? Hey more raspberry imagine that. I admit this is quite delicious if you like raspberries. The alcohol is also nonexistent, in fact it almost tastes a bit like drinking a 3% lambic. The body is quite full on this one as well.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of raspberries, cereal malts, a little Belgian yeast and slightly sour funk.  Pours dark purple with an average purple pink head that left good lace.  Flavor is very sweet and tart.  Palate is full bodied and oily soft/average carbonation.  Wow, just wonderful.  The raspberry is upfront and center but the sour and yeast notes accent everything perfectly.  Phenomenal beer!

On tap at MBGSF 2011.  Pours a red pink with a pink head.  Has a strong red grape aroma with sharp raspberry.  Flavor has sharp tart raspberry with red grapes, maybe some toffee, hints of cocoa.  Really, this is one great, tasty beer.
On tap at PinocchioÂ’s in Media.  People pour, aroma of raspberry.  Tart raspberry flavor, rich and full bodied.  Enough tartness to balance out the huge sweetness.  Great beer for a fruit one.

This poured a very dark red almost pruple color, plum like, with an awesome pink head. Aroma was fresh ripe tar raspberries, lots of seeds, some light yeast and some acidic notes. Flavor was much like the aroma, but more intense, a mix of sweet and tart raspberries, like belgian spice and yeast, acidic and again nice grainy seedy character too. Just awesome stuff.

Bottle @ home, bushmat1. Thanks Matt! Gorgeou, slightly violet, red appearance with a reddish cream head. Raspberry, fizzy, Italian soda nose. Fizzy, potent, tart raspberry, sweet, bubbly flavor. Tart raspberry aftertaste. Pretty nice.

Bottle pours dark plum color with thin but persistent pink head.  Aroma berries and a little yeast.  Flavor dominated by berries, not a huge amount of sweetness.  Finish a bit tart with prolonged berries.  Alcohol slightly apparent.  Palate thick, slightly syrupy, minimal carbonation
Pleasant, but essentially like drinking tart raspberry juice with some alcohol and yeast flavor.  I liked it.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 This is easily one of the most impressive and beautiful pours IÂ’ve seen. Sits the color of an overripe blackberry and two fingers of dense bright magenta head provide a striking contrast.  Ripe raspberry flesh in the nose with a light earthy yeast character and a slight acidity. You can smell the seeds in this, extremely rich and authentic raspberry character.  Light peppery and acidic character from the yeast. Rich and velvety smooth mouthfeel with a light tartness and prickling carbonation. B.O.S.S

Bottle, thanks ethan for sharing.  Pretty pour--Dark raspberry red with a thick pinkish head and nice lacing.  Nose shows lots of berries, a bit of metal, soap and honey.  Flavor shows some malt and raspberry upfront, slightly sweet, slightly tart, a little bit of booze.   Finishes slightly dry.  Okay, but itÂ’s no raspberry tart.  Just sayin.

Snifter on tap at Tribes (Mokena, IL). Pours a deep purple red hue, murky and dark with some lighter glowing edges. A raspberry pie filling hue with a small pinking purple frothy head that dies to a tiny film, laces small. Aromas are a rich sweet berry presence, tannins, genuine fruit feel that throws a touch of tartness, pulp, and more fruit. Lush raspberry presence. Initial is medium bodied, a potent sweet and tart berry presence, luscious raspberry pulp and seeds, deep crimson berry sweetness. Genuine fruit, less tart than the New Glarus version. Sweet and rich berry, pulpy with the tartness coming on into the backend. Raspberry is one of my favorite all-fruit pies, and this reminds me of it so much. Rich real fruit/berry presence. Finish is raspberry skin/tannins with some decent tartness, pretty good, maybe a touch syrupy and or cough drop-y, but not into any sort of cloying realm. Based on my memory of the original, this is considerably sweeter.. But then again, that one was aged.

25 oz bottle.  Deep bloody red with pink froth.  Nose is raspberry jam and ginger ale with a slight metallic tang.  Thick and syrupy but not as sweet as you would expect.  Reminds me of melted Jolly Ranchers with a faint sparkle.  Taste is raspberry, blackberry and candi with a touch of yeast to dry it out.  Intensely fruity and thatÂ’s an understatement.

Bottle.Pours a deep red with great carbonation.Nose is raspberry,bready yeast notes.Taste is awesome....bright,tart almost sour raspberry.Mouth feel is just perfect with tart and creamy goodness all around.Truly stellar fruit beer.One of the best.

Thanks for sharing, bro.  Pours a bright raspberry color with a medium pink head.  Aroma is acidic, raspberries.  Taste is sweet and refreshing raspberries and not overly cloying.  Palate reminds me of aged blue cheese.......it was kind of weird.
Draft @ Founders, DEEP raspberry red w/ minimal head, aroma is rich fruit, heavy raspberry and pomegranate, flavor is a flood of vinous berries, with a dry finish, spectacular

750ml bottle, 2011 bottling.

Pour is crazy for a beer, looks like a carbonated red wine. Deep burgundy red with lighter pink edges underneath a small pink head that recedes to a thin collar.

Aroma is raspberries, obviously, with some underlying Belgian notes, some malts and yeast. But the raspberries are the star here.

Taste is like raspberries dipped in brown sugar with hints of the earthy yeast underneath. Big malty backbone comes through as well though, again, itÂ’s all about the raspberries. Not even a trace of alcohol which is surprising.

Mouthfeel is full bodied for a fruit beer. Might be the biggest fruit beer IÂ’ve ever had actually.

This is a seriously big raspberry beer, though I never would have guessed the ABV. I wouldnÂ’t exactly call it drinkable as he sweetness is pretty massive but I enjoyed it nonetheless.

Tart yet fruity sweet. From the bright pink head to the last dark red drop, this beer aims to please, and, for me anyway, it totally succeeds. ItÂ’s definitely a fruit beer and makes no qualms about it. A punch of fresh raspberry (like eating the fruit, not simply raspberry flavored) is present all the way through with a lasting sweet and tart finish. IÂ’m going to have to grab another before it sells out!

Pours deep ruby into a snifter. Bright pink conglomerate head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet crushed raspberries and seed aromas. Medium bodied with sweet raspberry jam from front to back.  Alcohol is well-hidden this time around.

Sample at Founders. Everything about this one screams raspberry, from the color to the aroma and, yes, the taste. ItÂ’s quite tart, with some sweetness. The palate is syrupy, yet not too thick. ItÂ’s very tasty. Certainly worth a try, and is well suited to be a dessert beer.

Bottle. Accidently dropped it and the cap came off. Ruby pour with pinkish head. Raspberry, belgian candied sigar, yeasts, and some hints of alcohol aroma. Flavor follows, sweet and ends a bit more dry and warm.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Pours dark magenta with a foamy pink head. Strong berry, raspberry preserves and candied fruit in the aroma. Taste is slightly tart berries, raspberry preserves, cherry pie, and candy. This is sweet but not too over the top. Body is very light and bubbly with a sugary stickiness. Finishes with more tart berry, raspberries jam, Smuckers-like jam, hint of cherry pie and more candy.

Bottle via trade with a friend in Michigan, thanks Mike!  Pours a deep, dark purple to almost black.  You only know it is purple when you see the light pink head that is minimal to non-existent unless you really pour at just the right angle.  The aroma is heavy raspberry beyond belief.  I immediately compare it to Raspberry Tart but feel this has even more of a nose.  The taste is once again, raspberry juice.  If it left with that I would have been disappointed but then at the end the slight malt bill and alcohol come into play.  The alcohol on this really makes me bump it up even more because it lets you know you arenÂ’t drinking a sparkling raspberry cider over Thanksgiving dinner when you were 10.  It adds, does not detract.  Overall this is an outstanding beer.  Too sweet to have all the time but glad I got to try this and will look to land another bottle before itÂ’s all gone for the season.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle. Popped open a bottle by my lonesome tonight as I really wanted to try this one and it sitting in my fridge was way too much a temptation on a friday night. Pours an extremely dark rosie, red color with a deep reddish pink head. Hmm, ever so slight belgian yeast esters upfront that then gets dominated by a hard core raspberry aroma. I have a feeling on this one that the taste is going to follow the nose. Raspberry, raspberry, and a touch of additional raspberry. Head settles to form a pink collar around the glass. As with the nose, their is a slight belgian flare to this that quickly transitions to a full frontal assault of raspberry flavor. Tart and sweet. Slight bitter in the end. Leaves the mouth feeling like it just ate something really sweet. Medium mouthfeel. I need to try this next to New Glarus Raspberry Tart to see which I like better, but this is really good as a sweet fruity beer.

2011 Bottle; Pour is dark raspberry, with a dark pink head that retains on the average side; average lacing is present in this glass as well. The nose is raspberry jam and alcohol. This brew is sweet, tart, raspberry jam, raspberry seeds, with a malt profile that takes a back seat to the raspberry character - its just a wow beer for me because of how different it feels.
Pours purple with a pinkish purple head. Aroma is sweet raspberries. Flavor is again lots of raspberry starts sweet and finishes lightly tart, a little spicy yeast, and earthiness.

Bottle from SamÂ’s in Durham. Pours dark ruby, but clear. One-finger head the color of strawberry milk. Lovely, strange pour. Nose is fresh mashed raspberries, along with a strong raspberry seed character and bitter wood notes. Hints of Belgian yeast; less so than the original, I think. Something a bit plasticky deep in the aroma that throws me off a bit. Taste is thick raspberry syrup at first, but the finish is more earthy and surprisingly dry. Full, syrupy palate. I feel a slight disappointment in that I wanted something tart, but IÂ’m fascinated by these woody/seedy/earthy notes.
I thought this beer had a great aroma, and color was beautiful. For the style this beer was done very well.

Draft. Pour is a dark hazy pink with an excellent white head, good retention/lacing. Aroma is fresh raspberries and not much else. Flavor is mouth puckering raspberries which mellows to sweet raspberry juice. Palate is soft, slick, clean finish. Really outstanding and on par with New Glarus but with distribution outside of Wisconsin!

What a delightful beer this was.  Pours a rich raspberry color with intense pink bubbly head. Aroma is of intense raspsberries, light floral hops and mild malt aroma.  This tastes like a jelly donut that was converted into beer.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Solid beer.

On tap at Founders Brewing. Dark purple-red pour with very pink foam. Aroma of pure raspberry, seeds and all. Taste is sweet, with only a slight "natural" tartness from the raspberries and finishes with a slight touch of belgian ale yeastiness as though to make sure the sweet fruity flavors donÂ’t go on forever. Palate has medium carbonation and is quite full bodied. I never thought I would like this beer so much, it was our favorite of the night @ Founders.

750ml bottle.  Pours a bright, ruby-red color with a pink head that fades pretty quickly.  Aroma is nothing by raspberry.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, raspberry, some spicy Belgian yeast, with a sweet, raspberry finish.  Not as tart as New GlarusÂ’s Raspberry, but just as good.

Tasted on 7/5/11 on draft at Founders.  Pours a cloudy dark blood red with nothing more than a thin collar of pink lace.  The nose is slightly earthy yeast with a bit of caramel and bread malt coming through, but the focus is, of course, the raspberries, which range from tart to syrup sweet.  The flavor is pretty perfect with the sweet and tart raspberries at the center of attention.  There is also some earthy yeast and some caramel malt.  The body is full with mouth-filling lively carbonation and a long sweet and tart raspberry finish.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2011 Pour from bottle is pinkish purple with very pink colored head, fizzy but lasts and coats the glass.  A crazy looking beer, in a good way, especially for a raspberry beer.  Aroma has notes of slight bread and yeasty components, raspberry jam with a touch of tart.  Taste is some sweet, slight tart raspberries, leading into bready and slightly spicy notes, finishing with a touch more raspberries, slighty dry but mostly sweet.  Rerated, way more raspberries in this beer, not overly sweet actually tart. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Deep merlot in color with awesomely pink/purple head that fizzes and dissipates.  Floral raspberry aroma.  Solid raspberry flavor that starts semi-sweet, morphs to tart then ends with a trailing tartness and a bit of bitterness.  Huge on the palate.  Nice complexity and balance.  WhereÂ’s the booze hiding? Very impressed, especially since I can walk out my door and get Raspberry Tart whenever I want.  Kudos to you Founders, this was great.  Re-rate:  just not digging as much as the original release.  Flavor seems more muted, sweet, and less sour.  Overall still solid. -4

Deep Red color, light pink head. This was very easy to drink, I generally donÂ’t enjoy sweet fruity beers. This was unlike any I have ever tried, had genuine flavors that included not just sweet but tart tastes as if it was a smoothy. The aroma was true to the taste, I would continue to pay the current asking price if they would continue to make it.

Sample at Founders tap room. Deep clear maroon color with frothy pink head. Big aroma of raspberries, candi sugar, and a slight sour hint in the aroma...but mainly pureed raspberries. Taste is sweet and lightly tart. Mouthfeel is smooth with nice lively carbonation. This was delicious.

750 ml bottle, 2011 vintage.  Served in a flute, the beer pours a ruby red/purple color with about a half inch dark pink head that went away quickly.  Not much lacing.  The brew smells like fresh sweet raspberries, raspberry jam and a bit of tart raspberries.  Taste is similar to the aroma, it tastes mostly like sweet raspberries and raspberry jam along with some tart raspberry, too.  Also, thereÂ’s a little bit of bready yeastiness noticable.  But this beer is definitely all about the raspberries!  Mouthfeel/body is medium, itÂ’s creamy and has moderate carbonation.  ItÂ’s smooth and very easy to drink.  I think this is a pretty good overall brew, itÂ’s certainly one of if not the best raspberry beers IÂ’ve ever had.  Even at $14.99 a bottle IÂ’d definitely buy this again in the future, I thought it was worth the money.

Dark deep burgundy color; very pink head. Fresh pureed raspberry, very intense. Very dense body, vinous, hides its alcohol very well. What stands out most is how clearly the raspberries show through in such a heavy beer.

Pours thick, dark plum. Almost looks like a fruit syrup in the glass. Aroma is belgian yeast, raspberriew, cherries and just plain old sugar. Flavor is sweet raspberry jam with a yeastiness and almost dry finish. Pretty full bodied and very little carbonation. A nice little aperitif.

Pours dark purple with a purple/pink dense head.  The aroma is dominated by lush hearty raspberries that has a bit of sourness to it.  There is a bit of sweetness, but overall it is pretty dry for a fruit beer that is over 9% abv.  Really enjoyable aroma.  Medium / full body with a bit of seedy feel and a bit of gentle flowing carbonation at the end.  Starts with raspberries that are a bit on the tart side.  Raspberries are at the forefront at every point of the taste here.  There is some pepper, light star anise and a crispness towards the end.  There is no alcohol to be found on the taste - pretty impressive for a beer of this strength.  Really great fruit beer.

750ml bottle (2011). Pour dark ruby with a frothy pink head that fades to a  sudsey tight collar. Aroma is tart raspberries. Taste is bitter and tart raspberries with what I want to call wood as well. Palate is full and somewhat creamy with a tart dry finish. Awesome....

bottle.  blood red with small pink head.  strong raspberry juice aroma.  the flavor is concentrated raspberry juice.  light bready malt finish.  body is full and juicy.  you could say syrupy like pie filling.  i almost feel like there should be gritty raspberry seeds in here.  one of the best fruit beers iÂ’ve had.

Pours deep, hazy red, almost blood red, with pink head and little lacing.  Aromas of raspberries and thatÂ’s about it.  Taste is sweet and tart.   The raspberries just pour out of this on the front end and the tartness on the back.  Solid lively carbonation in this medium  bodied beer.  Overall, this is a nice distraction from the IPAÂ’s I usually drink.  Not too heavy and a nice ale for summer.

750 ml bottle poured into a chalice.  Beer pours a blood red with a pink head that dissipates quickly.  The aroma is sweet and fruity with some bready notes.  The beer tastes like a big raspberry, sweet and juicy with bready notes from the yeast.  Very sweet, possibly a little too much, but there is a tartness on the finish but it takes a while to kick in.  Very well done overall, and one that is worth seeking out as it is hard to find.  Very much like the New Glarus Raspberry Tart....another great beer.  Great for summer.

Wow!  Deep raspberry red, with lacing around the glass. Huge sweet and tart raspberry aroma. Full bodied, with medium carbonation but smooth drinking. Flavor starts sweet with raspberries and malt, but finishes with a blissfully tart erurption. Absolutely fantastic! The alcohol is really well hidden and the fruit is front and center. Well-done!

Poured a dark pink head. Big fruit aroma, the taste was outstanding. There was an abrupt finish that I thought was brought about by the acidity of the fruit. Almost reminded me of a Lambic but so much smoother. I have never tasted anything like this. Bright and refreshing... Great job again, Founders.

Bottle from GreenÂ’s. Vibrant burgundy pour with a nice deep red colored head. Looked like a sparkling red wine. Gorgeous.  Aroma was full of ripe, fresh raspberry. Jumps out of the glass. Flavors were rather tart from the get go. Big raspberry from top to bottom, light sour, somewhat mouth puckering. Sweet but not overly sweet, fitting. Mouthfeel was smooth, lightly carbonated. Finished with a nice, big raspberry tartness. Another nicely done fruit beer from Founders. CanÂ’t wait for the next big bottle release.

Draft. Founders. Pours dark red with medium pink colored head. Aroma of sharp tart raspberry and some funk. Flavor is massive in fresh raspberry puree, more raspberry, and finished with heavy raspberry. Insanely good and perfectly done. Awesome.
